question.text: If the principal quantum number <math> <mrow> <mtext>n</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>,</mo></mrow> </math> the correct sequence of filling of electrons will be:

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo>→</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mo>→</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">f</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mo>→</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mo>→</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">f</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo>→</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">f</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mo>→</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo>→</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">f</mi><mo>→</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></math>

solution.text:
As per n+l rule electrons fill first in that orbital which have least n+l value.
When n+l values are same, then electron fills that orbital which have lowest n value.
when n=6 as per n+l rule when n=6
ns subshell ⇒6+0=6

n−1 d subshell ⇒5+2=7

n−2 f subshell ⇒4+3=7

np subshell ⇒6+1=7

ns , n-2f, n-1d,np

n+l values ⇒7, 7, 7 

n value ⇒4, 5, 6
